DOCNAME: CASE OF ÖZALP AND OTHERS v. TURKEY
CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 2 with regard to death;Violation of Art. 2 with regard to effectiveness of investigation;No violation of Art. 3;Not necessary to examine Art. 6;Violation of Art. 13;Pecuniary damage - financial award;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award;Costs and expenses partial award
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants ( see paragraph CARDINAL ) , who were born in DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE , and DATE respectively , are the wife and children of the deceased , ORG , who was killed in DATE while he was under custody .

CARDINAL . Until DATE , the PERSON family resided in the ORG village in GPE in province of ORG . When the security forces started to pressurise the ORG family members to become village guards , the family moved to ORG in DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE of the applicants , Mr PERSON , went back to Bismil to visit the fields that belonged to his family . When he arrived in Bismil , he was stopped by soldiers and questioned about his father , ORG . He was subsequently taken to the gendarme command , where he was further questioned about his father . During the interrogation , ORG told them where they could find ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG was taken into custody in GPE . On DATE , Hacı saw his father in custody however he was not allowed to speak to him .

CARDINAL . On DATE Hacı was released from custody . On DATE , while he was still in ORG , he was informed by an acquaintance that an incident had taken place in the PERSON village and that it concerned his father . Consequently , when ORG went to the PERSON village to find out more about this incident , he met a villager , called ORG , who told him that his father was dead .
CARDINAL . On DATE QUANTITY police officers visited ORG 's house in ORG and told ORG 's uncle that ORG had died .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants ' representatives filed a petition with the public prosecutor attached to ORG . Referring to the investigation that had been commenced into the death of ORG and the decision of non - prosecution that had been delivered by ORG public prosecutor , the applicants ' representatives requested a copy of the arrest and autopsy reports as well as the public prosecutor 's decision of non - prosecution .
CARDINAL . NORP The public prosecutor refused to give these documents and noted at the bottom of the petition the following :

“ It has been decided [ by this office ] that no prosecution should be brought about the death of PERSON [ Note : ORG 's name is spelled out as GPE in the public prosecutor 's note . ] pursuant to LAW . The investigations in order to apprehend the co - activists of PERSON are still ongoing . A copy of the investigation file could not have been given [ to the representatives ] in accordance with the relevant provisions of the LAW , as it would constitute disclosure of the content and the subject matter of the investigation file . ”

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG was taken into custody by the gendarmes from the ORG on suspicion of membership of the ORG , proscribed as a terrorist organisation . He was suspected of aiding and abetting the ORG terrorists .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date ORG gave a statement to the gendarmes . He stated that the ORG terrorists were occasionally staying in his house and that he was providing them with food and military equipment such as weapons , clothes and medicine . He further stated that he had dug a shelter with the terrorists on the slopes of a hill near LOC in the Sarıhüseyin hamlet attached to the Serçeler village to hide some equipment .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG was taken to ORG for medical examination . According to the medical report , there were no signs of ill - treatment on his body .

CARDINAL . On DATE at TIME the gendarmes conducted a search to find out the location of the shelter that had been mentioned by ORG in his statement . ORG guided the soldiers to the shelter near the ORG road in the GPE village . While protecting themselves in a secure distance , the soldiers asked him to open the cover of the shelter . As he opened the cover , the soldiers witnessed a big explosion , which tore ORG 's body into pieces . The explosives had been placed in the entrance to the shelter by other members of the ORG and the soldiers found weapons , medical equipment and clothes in the shelter . The incident was further reported to the ORG public prosecutor .

CARDINAL . On DATE an on - site examination was conducted by the ORG public prosecutor together with a doctor . According to an onsite body examination , it was established that both legs were severed as a result of the explosion . No other signs of injury were observed on the dismembered body . The doctor decided that it was unnecessary to conduct a full autopsy on the body . ORG 's corpse was then given to Mr PERSON , a member of the ORG village assembly . An incident report was further drafted by the gendarmes and was signed by CARDINAL non - commissioned officers and the village mayor Mr ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the public prosecutor at ORG decided that no prosecution should be brought against ORG on account of his membership of the ORG on the ground that he had died on CARDINAL DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG public prosecutor accused the non - commissioned officer , Mr PERSON , of failing to take the necessary precautions when ORG had been asked to open the cover of the shelter and of causing ORG death through negligence . However , as the public prosecutor did not have the jurisdiction to bring proceedings against the non - commissioned officer , he declared lack of jurisdiction and transferred the case file to ORG .

CARDINAL . Subsequently , ORG appointed a major as a rapporteur to conduct further investigations into the killing of ORG . On DATE the major took statements from the non - commissioned officers , Mr PERSON , Mr PERSON and PERSON , who had been on site during the incident of DATE . The officers stated that ORG had been taken into custody on suspicion of membership of the ORG and had confessed that he had been aiding and abetting the terrorists , providing them with food , clothes , weapons and medical equipment . The soldiers further stated that ORG had mentioned a shelter which was used by the terrorists and when he was taken to the site to show the place of the shelter , the gendarmes had positioned themselves far from the shelter to prevent any loss of life . The soldiers explained that ORG was asked to open the shelter , however he had died as a result of the explosion . The officers finally stated that medical equipment and clothes had been found in the shelter .

CARDINAL . Basing himself on the statements of the CARDINAL accused non - commissioned soldiers , the incident and the body examination reports , on DATE the rapporteur submitted his report to ORG . He concluded that the security forces had taken all the necessary precautions before ORG was asked to open the cover of the shelter . The report further stated :

“ Having regard to the fact that ORG had confessed that he had dug a shelter [ with the other terrorists ] it was presumed that he could have known the place of the shelter and that he could have safely opened its cover himself . After the necessary safety measures had been taken , he had been asked to open the cover . However , he had died in an explosion . The explosives had been previously placed there by the terrorists . Neither the security forces nor ORG had noticed the explosives . ”

CARDINAL . NORP The report concluded that the security forces had performed their duty with diligence and it was recommended that no prosecution be brought against the members of the security forces .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG issued a decision stating that no prosecution should be brought against the members of the security forces . The council concluded that ORG had died as a result of the explosion and that the accused members of the security forces had performed their duty with diligence .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , to which the case had been automatically referred to by law , upheld the decision of ORG .
